item.title: Community Circles (CIRCOS) Program
item.description:
RIIAA CIRCOS Program

Role:
Co-founder & Chair

Period:
2020-05-01 to Current

Description:

The Community Circles (CIRCOS) is an innitiative launched in the context of RIIAA-2020 (International Meeting of Artificial Intelligence and Its Applications) – virtual edition.

The RIIAA CIRCOS program, inspired in Birds of a Feather (BoF) sessions, seek to build and strengthen the community in LATAM interested in Artificial Intelligence (AI) topics through parallel, interactive, informal and self-organized sessions (panels or round tables). CirCos provide a space for interested attendees to meet in small groups to exchange ideas and to form allies on issues of common interest. These topics may be directly or indirectly related to the topics covered in RIIAA-2020.

Main Activities:

  • Proposed and implemented the CirCos (Community Cicles) initiative as part of the 3rd RIIAA (International Meeting of Artificial Intelligence and Its Applications) – virtual edition. The CirCos initiative has the goal of increasing the interaction through informal discussions among members of the RIIAA community with similar interest in LATAM.
  • Coordinated the organization of 8 CirCos (virtual panels and round tables in the Hopin platform) resulting in engaging 40+ speakers from Guatemala, Mexico, Honduras, and USA, and an audience of 500+ across LATAM.

item.title: LatinXperiences Workshop
item.description:
LatinXperiences is an event that strives to create new and lasting connections between established researchers, at top-tier universities and research laboratories, and early-career researchers and students from Latin American countries.

There are thriving research and tech communities in Latin America that, for the most part, do not interact with the AAAI community. Our goal is to bring these communities together in a welcoming, social environment.

This workshop was one of the accepted diversity and inclusion activities at the AAAI-21 conference.

item.title: Panel Making a Career Transition Into Industry: Stories & Tips from Math, CS, and Stats Alumni
item.description: In this panel, alumni of graduate programs in mathematics, computer science, and statistics share how they successfully transitioned from academia into industrial positions in the areas of machine learning, AI, and data science. After learning from the story of each of our four panelists, we’ll have an extensive Q&A session.
